title: Gradient Descent / Parameter Optimization Audit
note: PRISM does not use traditional gradient descent. The category maps to surrogate-based and numerical optimization: Bayesian Optimizer (GP+acquisition), Regression Engine (OLS), and Interpolation Engine (spline).

algorithms_audited.name: BayesianOptimizer
algorithms_audited.approach: Gaussian Process surrogate with acquisition function optimization

algorithms_audited.name: RegressionEngine
algorithms_audited.approach: OLS polynomial regression via Normal Equation

linear.method: Piecewise linear with O(log n) binary search

cubic_spline.method: Natural cubic spline via tridiagonal system

derivatives.note: First derivatives for both linear and spline

findings.finding: BayesianOptimizer: GP surrogate with EI/UCB/PI acquisition functions correctly formulated
RegressionEngine: OLS Normal Equation with Gauss-Jordan -- correct for degree <= 4
InterpolationEngine: Natural cubic spline tridiagonal solver matches de Boor (1978)
All 3 algorithms implement Algorithm<I,O> interface consistently
RegressionEngine handles near-singular matrices with warning instead of crash
Prediction intervals are simplified (z*RMSE) -- acceptable for manufacturing use
No explicit gradient-descent exists -- appropriate for manufacturing where gradients are unavailable
